Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Symbol server when hosted on prem?" (#8154) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Is there some documentation for enabling the symbols server functionality when hosted on prem? Or is this not possible?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove SHA-1 verification in package signature job " (#8197) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: When NuGet client v5.8 is released, upgrade.

This adds support for ordering the "Published Packages" and "Unlisted Packages" tables on the "Manage my packages" screen, eg:

![sorting](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2829865/90201003-e7585d80-de1c-11ea-97f4-63af32948f99.gif)

Clicking on any of the column headers sorts by that column. I am by no means a JS guru but hopefully this does what we want and works for most people.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7806

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "package list can be sorted by ID, owners, downloads and version" (#8158) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This adds support for ordering the "Published Packages" and "Unlisted Packages" tables on the "Manage my packages" screen, eg:

![sorting](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2829865/90201003-e7585d80-de1c-11ea-97f4-63af32948f99.gif)

Clicking on any of the column headers sorts by that column. I am by no means a JS guru but hopefully this does what we want and works for most people.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7806

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]NVDA/Narrator is reading about the data which is not present on the screen at the table "Version History"" (#8196) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188406
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Repro Steps:

    Turn on NVDA
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Profile" button in the menu bar and press enter
    Tab till any Manage packages"  and press enter.
    Tab till search bar and search for 'Json' and press enter 
    Tab till the first result "Newtonsoft.Json" and press enter 
    Tab till "Version" of any result 
    Tab till "Version history" and press enter to expand
    Verify whether the NVDA is announcing the blank columns and allows navigation with CTRL + ALT + Arrow keys

## Actual Results:

NVDA/Narrator is reading about the data which is not present on the screen at the table "Version History"

   
## Expected Results:
Data should be visible on the screen.

Narrator/NVDA should read correct data which is present in the table and which is visible on the screen

Note: when data is not present in any column it would be better if screen reader announce it as empty cell.

## User Impact:

Screen reader users may not be understand about the columns in the table and also get confused with navigation 

## Notes
In a surprise twist, we are reading out too much information. This seems most likely connected to the fact that the table has columns that are not visible at all times (status, signature information, deprecation information). For cases where this information isn't present, it should not be in the table either (if it should never be presented). If it could possibly be presented, but it isn't filled in, we should indicate that the cell is empty.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Color contrast for the "Copy" button's background with page background ratio is 2.5:1 which is less than 3:1" (#8195) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188278
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Note:
Same issue is observed at Search button and for the stars in the table
## Repro Steps:

    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Profile" button in the menu bar and press enter
    Tab till any Manage packages"  and press enter.
    Tab till search bar and search for 'Json' and press enter 
    Tab till the first result "Newtonsoft.Json" and press enter 
    Tab till "Copy" button and  Check whether the color contrast for the background to icon is greater than equal to 3:1 or not

## Actual Results:

Color contrast for the background to focus on the icons Facebook and Twitter is which is less than 3:1.

   
## Expected Results:
Color contrast for the "Copy" button's background with page background ratio is 2.5:1 which is less than 3:1
## User Impact:
Users with low vision would face difficulty to identify the elements if the non-text contrast is less than 3:1

## Notes
This looks similar to https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8192
A global fix for this button type should be made.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]NVDA is not announcing the Status message displayed after selecting the create button without giving any glob pattern" (#8194) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188211
## Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Repro Steps:

    Turn on NVDA
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "API Keys" and Press enter
    Tab till "Create' Button and press enter to expand it
    Input all the fields except 'Glob pattern' 
    Tab till "Create button" and press enter
    Input all the fields except 'Glob pattern' 
    Verify whether the NVDA is reading the status message displayed or not

## Actual Results:

NVDA is not announcing the Status message displayed after selecting the create button without giving any glob pattern
## Expected Results:
Screen reader user should be able to know about the status message displayed after selecting create button without giving glob pattern. NVDA should announce immediately when it is displayed
## User Impact:
Screen reader users may not understand what is the issue occurred if the Screen reader is not announces the status message

## Notes
We will need a new aria-live region that will read this information out when it changes. This should be similar to the other aria-live regions we use for alerting.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Label name is not given at the control for the 'Select new member role' and 'change member role' dropdowns" (#8193) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Repro Steps:

    Change the Display resolution to 1280*1024 in System display settings
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "Manage organizations" and Press enter
    Tab till "Edit " present in any record the table and press enter
    Tab till Members and expand it 
    Tab till 'Select new member role' and verify the visual name is given or not

## Actual Results:
Label name is not given visually for the 'Select new member role' and 'change member role' dropdowns

## Expected Results:
Label name which is announcing by the screen reader for the Select new member role' and Change member role' should be given as visually. 
## User Impact:
Speech input users will face the issue as they may not be able to access this two dropdowns  

## Notes
Another aria-label fix. Should be fairly straightforward to fix. I don't believe the display resolution adjustment is necessary to repro.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Color contrast for 'Cancel' button foreground with background is 1.099:1 which is less than 3:1" (#8192) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188116
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Note:
Same issue is observed for throughout the application on 'Cancel" button
## Repro Steps:

    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "API Keys" and Press enter
    Tab till "Create button" and press enter
    Tab till "Cancel button" under the 'Select packages'  
    Check whether color contrast for 'Cancel' button's foreground with page background is meeting the required 3:1 ratio or not 

## Actual Results:

Color contrast for 'Cancel' button foreground with background is 1.099:1 which is less than 3:1
## Expected Results:
Low vision user  should be able to identify the button, so it should meet the required color contrast ratio 3:1
## User Impact:
Low vision users may not be able to identify the button if it is not meeting the required color contrast ratio.

## Notes
Looks like this will need a global fix. I believe we use a single set of CSS for the cancel button, so it should be sufficient to change this one time.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Some of the information is missed when reflow is applied" (#8191) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188115
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Note: 
Under 'Members' Administrator dropdown is not visible clearly after applying reflow
## Repro Steps:

    Change the Display resolution to 1280*1024 in System display settings
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "Manage organizations" and Press enter
    Tab till "Edit " present in any record the table and press enter
    Tab till Certificates and expand it 
    Apply reflow and Check whether data is missing or not  

## Actual Results:

Some of the data is missing when reflow is applied under the Certificates
## Expected Results:
User should be able to view the data without missing and all the information should be visible clearly with one scrollbar after applying reflow
## User Impact:
Users will not be able to see the information if it gets overlapped in reflow

## Notes
This is referencing the information on the Manage Organization page after setting minimum required CSS width (320 pixel). 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/92166001-bdc39e00-edec-11ea-8679-fef816b3a1a3.png)
The information on this page entirely is difficult to see at the minimum width.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Some of the contents under the select packages is getting overlapped when reflow is applied" (#8190) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188114
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Repro Steps:

    Change the Display resolution to 1280*1024 in System display settings
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "API Keys" and Press enter
    Tab till "Create button" and press enter
    Apply reflow
    Check whether data is overlapping is observed or not  

## Actual Results:

Some of the contents under the select packages is getting overlapped when reflow is applied 
## Expected Results:
User should be able to view the data without overlapping and all the information should be visible clearly with one scrollbar after applying reflow
## User Impact:
Users will not be able to understand the information if it gets overlapped in reflow

## Notes
This is in reference to the section in Create Key that shows example glob patterns. You do not have to change display resolution to see this. It is sufficient to shrink the window to minimum width and zoom in until the overlap occurs
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/92165397-d8e1de00-edeb-11ea-9bd8-7ce5bde30820.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Update dotnet cli vulnerable spec following spec review" (#9992) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
A few pieces have been updated here:
- `dotnet list package` default behavior is now unchanged
- `dotnet list package --vulnerable` (the new report) now has a colorized Severity column
- `dotnet list package --deprecated` now has `(O) and `(V)` markers
- `dotnet list package --outdated` now has `(D)` and `(V)` markers
- The `--offline` option is removed
- I've moved markers from requested to resolved columns, as these are the versions we assess
- I've taken out the (somewhat random) `--include-transitive` advisories that turned up in some footers
- General cleanup and disambiguation

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PM UI:  IProjectContextInfo.GetInstalledPackagesAsync(...) should not return IEnumerable<T>" (#9936) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Following RPC best practices, `IProjectContextInfo.GetInstalledPackagesAsync(...)` should return `IReadOnlyCollection<IPackageReferenceContextInfo>` instead of `IEnumerable<IPackageReferenceContextInfo>`.

CC @sbanni

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "RuntimeEnvironmentHelper.IsRunningOnVisualStudio performance issue on Mono" (#9989) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used - NuGet IDE support in VSMac

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.8.0-preview.3.6783

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): mono, macOS 10.15

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. NuGet implicitly calls `IsRunningInVisualStudio` in the `IsMono` check [here](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/e97d556a83750bb4f8017e3640bc699d04832657/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Common/RuntimeEnvironmentHelper.cs#L62), which then queries the BCL for the current process.

2. On mono, the first time initialization of Process.MainModule takes a long time, and it adds a few seconds to loading a solution in VSMac.

See sample trace here: https://gist.github.com/Therzok/9b2e09655e75aa0c4eeec25cc8df2123

This could be work-around by only querying `IsRunningInVisualStudio` on `Windows`, as VSMac does not have any `DEVENV` or `BLEND` processes it uses.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet PMC memory usage - investigate decreasing the amount of dlls loaded initially" (#9988) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Child of https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1167790.

To goal is to figure out there is a quick win as far as assembly loading goes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet PMC memory usage - invest whether tool window DontForceCreate is an option" (#9987) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Child of https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1167790. 

If the PMC is visible when VS shuts down, when VS starts, it's loaded even with no solution loaded. 
This 75 M memory penalty is incurred even if user never uses the PMC  in that session.
Please lazily initialize and DontForceCreate. This will reduce the penalty for many sessions with very little change.

PMC: When PMC is loaded because the last time VS closed, PMC was open: 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/extensibility/registering-a-tool-window?view=vs-2019

old link: https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/c53609dc-9146-4d82-a6c1-281eb960d243/how-to-hide-a-toolwindow-next-time-vs-starts-up

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Investigate if uninstall have more than 1 restore problem for reference type projects." (#9932) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

It's follow up for `Nuget Solution Package manager UI is slow because restore is run for every project instead of after all projects are updated ` [#6010](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6010) task. I solved [install/upgrade/downgrade cases](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/0f86276892b00c8abc41e94b186b32e1fc1a6b18/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Actions/UIActionEngine.cs#L842), but my changes doesn't cover uninstall case. For 2-3 sample solutions I tried doesn't have multi restore problem, but just in case need to check all code path to make sure.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PM UI:  Update button does not disable after update completes" (#9928) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Note:  this reproes in a private branch (dev-dtivel-oe-pmui-installuninstall) based on feature branch (dev-feature-OE.PMUI).  Basically, install/update was completely broken in dev-feature-OE.PMUI, and I've attempted to fix it in private branches.  This bug does not repro in latest dev.

1.  Create a .NET Core app project.
2.  Open PM UI.
3.  Install a package.
4.  On the newly installed package, select a different version and click Update.

Expected result:  After update completes, the update button will be disabled.

Actual result:  After update completes, the update button is not disabled.

Closed issue "Install Operation remoted in VS.Oe" (#9526) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Enable remoting of install command via contract defintiion, etc...

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Implement a pre-registration mechanism for legacy PR projects that call restore at solution open" (#9986) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Say you have a mix of legacy + SDK projects, where the legacy projects are say extensibility which call NominateProjectASync without data. 

Given that NuGet has no clue that it's supposed to wait for these projects(unlike nomination),  we should implement a registration mechanism, that tells NuGet to expect an `I'm ready` call to avoid duplicate restores.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Restore operations that throw due to a project not being loaded are reported as `NoOp` in telemetry" (#9985) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Found this while investigating solution load. 

Repro steps: 

* Open NuGet.sln with latest VS (not latest NuGet, cause some of the dragons are gone there). 

Observe: Error occurred while restoring NuGet packages: The operation failed as details for project Test.Utility could not be loaded.

In telemetry, this event is reported as no-op, which is sort of incorrect. 
It's more of a skipped/failed restore. 
We should think about how we want reason about these events. 

cc @dominoFire @aortiz-msft 

There are some queries we can do to understand the number of misrepresented events. It'll be nice to fix in 16.8

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
